title: 105_hr120
content:
The Bankruptcy Law Technical Corrections Act of 1997 amends definitions in title 11 of the United States Code, including adjustments to dollar amounts. The Bankruptcy Law Technical Corrections Act of 1997 makes adjustments to dollar amounts in title 11 of the United States Code, extends time limits, imposes penalties for fraudulent bankruptcy petitions, and updates eligibility criteria for trustees and employment of professional persons. The Bankruptcy Law Technical Corrections Act of 1997 amends sections in title 11 of the United States Code related to the employment and compensation of professional persons in bankruptcy cases. It updates the authority of trustees and limits on compensation for professional services. The Bankruptcy Law Technical Corrections Act of 1997 updates sections in title 11 of the United States Code regarding compensation of professional persons in bankruptcy cases. It amends provisions related to fixed or percentage fee basis, compensation to officers, special tax provisions, effect of conversion, and automatic stay. SEC. 9. EFFECT OF CONVERSION amended by inserting "of the estate" after "property". SEC. 10. AUTOMATIC STAY amended to include security interest provisions. SEC. 11. EXECUTORY CONTRACTS AND UNEXPIRED LEASES. Section 365 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include provisions regarding the satisfaction of penalty rates in contracts and nonmonetary obligations under leases. Subsections (c) and (d) are also revised, with paragraph (4) being removed. Subsection (f)(1) is modified to end with a period. SEC. 12. AMENDMENT TO TABLE OF SECTIONS.

Amends the item relating to section 556 to include a contractual right to liquidate commodities contracts or forward contracts.

SEC. 13. ALLOWANCE OF ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES.

Amends section 503(b)(4) of title 11, United States Code, to include subparagraphs (A), (B), (C), (D), or (E) before paragraph (3).

SEC. 14. PRIORITIES.

Amends section 507(a) of title 11, United States Code, by adjusting punctuation in paragraph (3)(B) and adding "unsecured" after "allowed" in paragraph (7).

SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS. SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS.

Amends section 522 of title 11, United States Code, by specifying liabilities and adjusting subsections. SEC. 16. EXCEPTIONS TO DISCHARGE. Amends section 523 of title 11, United States Code, by adding exceptions related to debts owed to a spouse, former spouse, or child of the debtor, and specifying conditions for debts on a prisoner by a Federal court. Also corrects a typographical error in subsection (e). SEC. 17. Amends section 524(a)(3) of title 11, United States Code, regarding the effect of discharge in bankruptcy cases. 

SEC. 18. Amends section 525(c) of title 11, United States Code, to provide protection against discriminatory treatment in bankruptcy proceedings.

SEC. 19. Amends section 541(b)(4)(B)(ii) of title 11, United States Code, related to property of the estate in bankruptcy cases.

SEC. 20. Amends section 546 of title 11, United States Code, regarding limitations on avoiding powers in bankruptcy proceedings.

SEC. 21. Addresses the liability of transferee of avoided transfer in bankruptcy cases. SEC. 21. Liability of transferee of avoided transfer in bankruptcy cases is amended to clarify the recovery process from a transferee that was not an insider at the time of the transfer. SEC. 22. SETOFF. Amends Section 553(b)(1) of title 11, United States Code by changing "362(b)(14)" to "362(b)(17)". SEC. 23. DISPOSITION OF PROPERTY OF THE ESTATE. Amends Section 726(b) of title 11, United States Code by removing "1009,". SEC. 24. GENERAL PROVISIONS. Amends Section 901(a) of title 11, United States Code by adding "1123(d)," after "1123(b),". SEC. 25. APPOINTMENT OF ELECTED TRUSTEE. SEC. 25. APPOINTMENT OF ELECTED TRUSTEE. Section 1104(b) of title 11, United States Code is amended to include provisions for the election and certification of an eligible, disinterested trustee by the United States trustee. Any disputes arising from the election shall be resolved by the court. SEC. 26-31 amends various sections of title 11, United States Code related to railroad line abandonment, plan contents, payments, and discharge. Key changes include updating references and subsections for clarity and accuracy. SEC. 31 amends section 1328(a) of title 11, United States Code regarding debt discharge, specifying exceptions for certain debts. SEC. 32 modifies section 1334(d) of title 28, United States Code related to bankruptcy cases and proceedings. SEC. 33 pertains to the Bankruptcy Review Commission. SEC. 33 of the Bankruptcy Reform Act of 1994 is amended by striking subsection (g) and redesignating subsection (h) as subsection (g). SEC. 34 amends section 156(a) of title 18, United States Code regarding knowing disregard of bankruptcy law or rule. SEC. 35 addresses the effective date and application of the amendments. SEC. 35 of the Bankruptcy Reform Act of 1994 specifies that the Act and its amendments will take effect upon enactment, with the amendments applying to cases under title 11 of the United States Code initiated after the enactment date.
